name: Individuelles Wohnen in Mitte!
summary: Meine Unterkunft liegt im Herzen Berlins; der Friedrichstadtpalast, die Museumsinsel und der Bundestag sind nur drei von vielen Sehenswürdigkeiten in Gehdistanz. Die hervorragende Verkehrsanbindung (S- Friedrichstraße, HBF und U Oranienburger Tor je 5-10 min Fußweg) ermöglicht es zudem, unkompliziert weitere Stadtteile zu entdecken.  Der besondere Reiz der Unterkunft liegt in ihrer Gemütlichkeit und der unschlagbaren Lage. Sie ist für Paare, Familien (bis 2 Kinder)  und Gruppen geeignet.

name: Doppelzimmer im Prenzlauer Berg
summary: Gemütliches Doppelzimmer in zentraler Lage, nahe Schönhauser Allee 5 Min. Fußweg. Das Zimmer ist ruhig zum Hinterhof gelegen und liebevoll eingerichtet. Cozy double room in the centre of Berlin. Schönhauser Allee just 5 min. to walk. Silent room to the backyard, furnished with love. Acogedora habitación doble en el Centro de Berlín. Schönhauser Allee a 5 Min. andando. Muy tranquilo en el patio trasero y amueblado con amor.
space: Die Unterkunft ist einfach und komfortabel eingerichtet. Die Zimmer sind separat voneinander getrennt und vom Flur aus zu erreichen. Jedes Zimmer hat einen eigenen Schlüssel. In der Wohnung haben wir eine Gemeinschaftsküche für max. 4-6 Personen und 1 Badezimmer. Im vorderen Bereich befindet sich ein kleines Atelier. Im Sommer kann die Außenterrasse zum Sitzen genutzt werden. The apartment is furnished comfortably but not kooky. The rooms are separated and can be reached from the corridor. Each room has its own key. The apartment has a communal kitchen for max. 4-6 persons and 1 bathroom. In the frontal part you find an Atelier. In the summer you can relax at the terrace outside. El apartamento es muy acojedor pero no en sentido extravagante. Las habitaciones estan seperadas y pueden ser accedidas por el pasillo. Cada habitacion tiene su propia llave. neighborhood_overview: Sehr liebevolle und familiäre Nachbarschaft. Es gibt sehr viele Restaurants und Ausgehmöglichkeiten. In 10 min. erreichst du alle wichtigen Shops, Kinos, Sportclubs und Cafés. Der bekannte Soda Club und vieles mehr befinden sich in unmittelbarer Nähe. In 15 min. Kannst du auch das Freibad erreichen und den großen Mauerpark. Direkt neben unserer Wohnung habt ihr die Möglichkeit Fahrräder auszuleihen. Very loving and family neighborhood. There are very many restaurants and entertainment. In 10 min. You reach all the important shops, cinemas, sports clubs and cafes. The famous Soda Club and much more are in the immediate vicinity. In 15 min. You can also reach the outdoor pool and the great Mauerpark. Right next to our apartment you have the possibility to rent bicycles.
notes: Zum Ende der Miete, den Schlüsselbund einfach in die blaue Box legen. At the end of the rental, simply put the keybord into the blue box.
transit: Straßenbahn direkt vor der Haustür, U2 und Ringbahn/ S-Bahn in 5 min. Fußweg zu erreichen. Tram directly in front of the front door, U2 and Ringbahn / S-Bahn in 5 min. Walk to reach.
access: Meine Gäste haben durch den langen Flur Zugang zum Badezimmer und Küche sowie privates Zimmer welches auch abgeschlossen werden kann. My guests have access to the bathroom and kitchen through the long corridor as well as private room which can also be completed.
interaction: Ich arbeite im Aussendienst und bin selten in der Wohnung , aber man kann mich täglich erreichen. Im vorderen Bereich haben wir unser kleines Atelier, somit ist immer ein Ansprechpartner und nette Unterhaltung vor Ort. I work in the aftere sales service and I am rarely in the apartment, but you can reach me daily. In the front area we have our small studio, so there is always a contact person and nice entertainment on site.

name: Nice room @Warschauer Straße/RAW/East Side Gallery
summary: Hi everyone, in my room you'll find a comfortable bed and a sofa. You'll be looking into the quiet courtyard while being in Berlin's most popular part of town, with the famous Simon-Dach-Kiez, the RAW and the East Side Gallery right in front. This is my private room that I offer to visitors while I am most likely not in Berlin - so you'll find a lot of personal stuff and get a real "living in Berlin"-feeling!
space: Ihr habt Zugang zu einer neuen, modernen Küche und unserem Bad mit Badewanne/Dusche.
description: Hi everyone, in my room you'll find a comfortable bed and a sofa. You'll be looking into the quiet courtyard while being in Berlin's most popular part of town, with the famous Simon-Dach-Kiez, the RAW and the East Side Gallery right in front. This is my private room that I offer to visitors while I am most likely not in Berlin - so you'll find a lot of personal stuff and get a real "living in Berlin"-feeling! You'll have tram M10 (direct connection to Hauptbahnhof) just a couple of meters away, underground (U1 & U5 to Alexanderplatz) and S-Bahn (S7/75/5) are also in walking distance. Furthermore there is a bus station just 100 meters away that leads you to Ostbahnhof.
neighborhood_overview: Ihr seid hier in Friedrichshain, einem der beliebtesten Viertel Berlins. Ein paar Hundert Meter entfernt befindet sich der Simon-Dach-Kiez mit Restaurants, Bars und kleinen Geschäften aller Art. Die Spree ist nicht weit entfernt und das RAW-Gelände ist gerade einmal 3 Querstraßen weg - dort gibt es Flohmärkte, Urban Lifestyle, eine Boulderhalle und Clubs. Außerdem ist der berühmte Berghain-Club zwei Straßen weiter. Trotzdem ist es in diesem Teil der Grünberger Straße relativ ruhig, das Partyvolk zieht meistens an der circa 200 Meter entfernten Warschauer Straße entlang.  Direkt an der Warschauer Brücke befindet sich die Mercedes-Benz-Arena und gleich davor die berühmte East Side Gallery am Ufer der Spree.  Der Alexanderplatz mit dem Fernsehturm ist von hier zu sehen und in circa 30 Minuten zu Fuß zu erreichen, entlang der schönen Karl-Marx-Allee.
transit: You'll have tram M10 (direct connection to Hauptbahnhof) just a couple of meters away, underground (U1 & U5 to Alexanderplatz) and S-Bahn (S7/75/5) are also in walking distance. Furthermore there is a bus station just 100 meters away that leads you to Ostbahnhof.
house_rules: - Respectful behaviour - no smoking - no partying - cleaning of self-produced dirt in the flat (table, dishes...)

name: Cozy 1,5 room Apartment in Kreuzberg 50 qm
summary: I am renting out a beautiful, modern, fully furnished apartment in Berlin Kreuzberg.  50 qm with an living/kitchen area, big bedroom and an modern bathroom. For any questions about the apartment, area etc don't hesitate to ask.
space: Ich vermiete eine gemütliche, neu renovierte, stilvoll eingerichtete Wohnung im Herzen Kreuzbergs; direkt am Paul Linke- Ufer.  Die Wohnung liegt in einer ruhigen, lärmfreien Straße im Hinterhaus.  Bestehend aus einer Wohnküche, einem großen Schlafzimmer und  modernem Bad.  Die Küche ist komplett ausgestattet inklusive Kaffeemaschine, Toaster, Wasserkocher, Kühlschrank, Ofen, Spüle.  Im Schlafzimmer ist ein großes, gemütliches Boxspringbett (180x200cm), ein Sofa, Tisch mit Stühlen und Schränkchen.  Das Bad hat den Luxus einer Fußbodenheizung und einer sehr großzügigen Dusche.  UBAHN: Görlitzer Bahnhof (U1), Schönleins (U8) außerdem mehrere Busse.

name: Private room+bath in modern flat
summary: For Christmas and new year's eve please only apply if you have 5+ host recommendations. In this case the flat will be yours, Confirmation will only be given for such profiles.
space: The room available for rent is app. 23 sqm. From this room you can access your own bathroom (8 sqm, bathtub & walk-in shower) and a separate outside loggia (8 sqm). The bedroom is equipped with a kingsize bed (180x200 cm), a desk, a wardrobe and a small tv. It is located towards the silent backyard. Due to the layout it feels like a little apartment in the apartment. The flat is fully equipped and you usually do not need to bring anything here except your personal belongings.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is located within the Simon-Dach-Area, next to the RAW and close to Boxhagener Platz. To go to Volkspark Friedrichshain it needs about 15 minutes with tram line M10. Treptower Park is 2 stops by S-Bahn or 15 jogging minutes away. In the closer vicinity you find all things that you need: 24h supermarket, 24h kiosks, drugstores, cash machines, health-food-shops, plenty of restaurants / bars serving good food & beverages for moderate prices.
transit: If you should want to leave Friedrichshain for some reason going to Kreuzberg, Mitte or Prenzlauer Berg is very easy. Here is a list of all public transport connections including direct stops: - S-Bahn S5, S7, S75 "Warschauer Str." (to Ostkreuz, Alexanderplatz, Friedrichstraße, Hauptbahnhof or Zoologischer Garten) - 5 minutes walk - U-Bahn U1 "Warschauer Str." (to Kottbusser Tor, Hallesches Tor, Wittenbergplatz or Kurfürstendamm) - 5 minutes walk - U-Bahn U5 "Frankfurter Tor" (to Alexanderplatz or Lichtenberg) - 8 minutes walk - Tram M10 "Revaler Strasse" (to Volkspark Friedrichshain, Greifswalder Strasse, Prenzlauer Allee, Eberswalder Strasse or Hauptbahnhof) - 2 minutes walk - Tram M13 "Revaler Strasse" (to Frankfurter Allee) - 2 minutes walk
interaction: Normally I will be living here as well. So feel free to ask for any help or advice at any time.

summary: Die Wohnung ist sehr zentral gelegen: 3 Gehminuten zu den Stationen Samariterstrasse und Frankfurter Tor (U5), 5 Gehminuten zur Ringbahn.  Alle Geschäfte direkt ums Eck, genau wie leckere Restaurants, Bars und Kioske. In 5 Minuten ist der angesagte Simon-Dach-Kiez und der beliebte Boxhagener Platz zu erreichen. description: Die Wohnung ist sehr zentral gelegen: 3 Gehminuten zu den Stationen Samariterstrasse und Frankfurter Tor (U5), 5 Gehminuten zur Ringbahn.  Alle Geschäfte direkt ums Eck, genau wie leckere Restaurants, Bars und Kioske. In 5 Minuten ist der angesagte Simon-Dach-Kiez und der beliebte Boxhagener Platz zu erreichen. Die Wohnung hat zwei Dachterrassen mit tollem Blick - das Frühstück lässt sich in der Morgensonne genießen:) Meine Unterkunft eignet sich für Singles, Paare und Familien. Die Wohnung ist in Top-Zustand und ganz neu - sie ist super isoliert und ruhig. Sie ist sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet und man fühlt sich sofort "pudelwohl":)  WLAN kostenlos vorhanden und nutzbar. Die Wohnung ist frisch ausgebaut, mit 114 qm sehr groß und lädt mit einer großen Dachterrasse zum Sonnenbaden ein. Sie liegt im 5. Stock mit Aufzug, ist super hell und vor allem sehr ruhig. Wer gerne weit blickt, ist hier richtig: von drei Zimmern aus sieht man sogar den Berliner Fernsehturm. Die Küche ist voll ausg
neighborhood_overview: Der Kiez direkt vor der Tür ist sehr ruhig, einmal über die Frankfurter Allee rüber hat man jedoch alles, was das kulinarische Herz begehrt - aber auch Bars und Clubs. Auch der beliebte Wochenmarkt auf dem Boxhagener Platz ist direkt ums Eck.  In 5 Minuten erreicht man außerdem alle Einkaufsmöglichkeiten: Rewe, Lidl, Bio Company, Kaiser's, Bäcker, DM - außerdem ist das Ringcenter-Einkaufscentrum fußläufig erreichbar. Zudem finden sich in den umliegenden Straßen viele süße Cafés und kleine Läden sowie Boutiquen.
transit: In wenigen Gehminuten erreicht man die U 5 (Samariterstraße oder Frankfurter Tor), in 10 Minuten ist man an der Ringbahn-Station Storkower Straße oder Frankfurter Allee.  Die Parkplatzsituation ist gut.
access: Die Wohnung ist frisch ausgebaut, mit 114 qm sehr groß und lädt mit einer großen Dachterrasse zum Sonnenbaden ein. Sie liegt im 5. Stock mit Aufzug, ist super hell und vor allem sehr ruhig. Wer gerne weit blickt, ist hier richtig: von drei Zimmern aus sieht man sogar den Berliner Fernsehturm. Die Küche ist voll ausgestattet mit Spülmaschine, Geschirr, großem Kühlschrank und neuem Herd.  Im Wohnzimmer gibt es einen 50''-Fernseher (mit Netflix-Zugang:) und gemütlichem Sofa.  Am Esszimmertisch finden bis zu 6 Leute Platz.  Dein Zimmer ist ebenfalls sehr hell und verfügt über ein 140x200m Bett, das man leicht zum Sofa umklappen kann. Außerdem gibt es eine große Kommode, eine Kleiderstange, Sitzmöglichkeit und eine Steckerleiste mit USB-Anschluss. Kopfkissen und Bettdecke brauchst du nicht mitbringen, ist vorhanden:)  Desweiteren hast Du dein eigenes Badezimmer mit Dusche komplett für dich zur eigenen Nutzung.
interaction: Ich bin 26 Jahre alt, lebe seit fast 10 Jahren in Berlin und liebe diese Stadt. Als Kameramann bin ich beruflich viel unterwegs und auch oft mal mehrere Tage im Ausland.  Da ich ein Auto besitze, kann man auch gern mal gemeinsam einkaufen fahren oder Getränke kaufen gehen. Wenn du neu bist in Berlin, kann ich dich natürlich auch gern mit Tipps und Infos über die Hauptstadt versorgen. Also alles sehr unkompliziert bei mir, allerdings solltest du keine Katzenallergie haben: Maxi (8) ist eine sehr liebe und hübsche britisch Kurzhaar-Miez, sehr zurückhaltend und ihre Lieblingsbeschäftigung ist: schlafen.
host_about:
Love travelling the world and getting to know new cool people and places:)
Also i enjoy having people in my apartment so that they can experience this amazing Berlin city! I just recently moved into this brandnew apartment.

The modern apartment is adapted to the design concept of our cafe situated in the same house: There are selected findings, playful and discovering unexpected details. The modern apartment is rented on a daily basis to 2 to 4 people and features a spacious living area and 2 sleeping areas, each with a double bed, and a fully equipped kitchen, 1 bathroom with shower and bath on the 2nd floor. The apartment is fully equipped with towels and sheets, and can be reached by elevator.

name: big apartment in Prenzlauer Berg
summary: Our cosy and big 2 rooms apartment (75sqm) is centrally located in popular Prenzlauer Berg district, directly at the Mauerpark. Right around the corner you will find plenty of cafés and alternative-style bars!
space: Location  Our big 2 rooms apartment (75sqm) is centrally located in the beautiful and trendy Prenzlauer Berg district. Right around the corner you will find plenty of cafés and alternative-style bars. The popular Mauerpark is only a 5 min stroll away, with his famous international flea market and music and culture events! Also nearby is Kulturbrauerei (about 10min), an old brewery with shops and nightlife.  It's located in the forth floor, It's hidden from the street life. There are two separated beds, so its a perfect flat not just for couples.  The tram (M1,M10,M12) is about 7 min. walk away and needs only a short distance to Mitte Neighbourhood with highlights like the Oranienburgerstrasse, Hackescher Markt or Alexanderplatz.

name: Prettiest Room in Friedrichshain's Best Location !
summary: We are renting our beautiful 28m2 Room in the heart of Friedrichshain, close to everything.  The apartment is situated right by Warschauer Strasse S-Bahnof and U-Bahnhof, and both the tramway line M10 and M13, which links to most of the inner city. It's also 5 minutes walk to Schlesiches Tor.  You will find around the house, many restaurants, bars, nightclubs, Historic sites, shopping facilities, 24/7 open Kiosks. 5 min from Berghain, 10 min from Kater Blau, 15 min from Wilde Renate.

name: Charming lighty Room in Kreuzberg
summary: Located in the best part of Kreuzberg with a lot of calme and its nice restaurants and bars is my flatshare! Since I´m a travel girl my room is often vacated - your opportunity to dive into the real Berlin!
space: It´s a beautiful room in an old building with old wooden floors and high ceilings. The room is big, spacious with a cozy double bed, a sofa and a small 60's desktop, where you can work or write postcards. With me, there´s one other people living in the apartment, 2 germans and one french girl; everyone is over 28 and everyone is a real berliner based person; they are amazing, and also, they are not so often home. So you will feel supported but not annoyed at all. Since we´re a flatshare the bathroom might not be perfectly clean at times (not often, though), which we hope you won´t mind. We make sure to keep it totally tolerable for everyone, and if there´s ever any concern for you just let us know because we want you to feel at home here and as satisfied with your stay as possible!
description: Located in the best part of Kreuzberg with a lot of calme and its nice restaurants and bars is my flatshare! Since I´m a travel girl my room is often vacated - your opportunity to dive into the real Berlin!
neighborhood_overview: This is the best part of Kreuzberg! Just around the canal , four minutes walking you will be on the heart of the beautiful green berlin. And at the other side of the street you have Marheineke Markthalle, and the Bergmanstrasse (far away enought to do not feel disturb about it continous life, but in a walking distance of four minutes); its the centre of this Kreuzberg area, there you can have a lot of different awesome food, as well shopping, in a lovely mood and with open spaces.  I love the atmosphere, international and alive, with a lot of kids playing on the park, and lot of  restaurants and cafés. You definitely have to checkt out the "Chapter One", an amazing professional barista coffee shop where they do one of the most amazing coffee of Berlin. Also close to the house are two of the more fancy and awesome green points in Berlin: the Hasenheide park, and the old airport Tempelhof (is a must to walk around there if you are visiting Berlin!)
notes: We´re usually busy doing our work routines so you are pretty much independent and it feels like you are alone in the flat most of the times.
transit: The flat is located extremely well, walking distance to a lot of interesting places for visit, and two minutes walking to the Gneisenaustrasse underground station, which drives you in 10 minutes in u-bahn to Mitte (the city center).
access: The U-Bahn station Gneisenaustrasse is only two minutes walk away, with this line U7 you can get directly to the airport Schonefeld, and also super well connected for Tegel. I will make a wellcome kit-map and explain you all this information. Also, there are plenty of supermarkets and shops where the room is located.
interaction: I will be in the city often, and in the opposite case, I will be always available for answering all your questions, so dont hesitate to contact me any time (almost 24 hours by phone and email) in case you got any questions or problems or you need something. If you want, the bed sleeps 2 people easily, so it´s suitable for friends/couples as well. If needed, an extra 120cm mattress can be put in. Usage of kitchen no problem, towels and linen are all there and included. You are welcome to help yourself to anything! Also, there´s a washing machine that you may use
host_about:
I think I could say I am free, open, easy, tolerant, dreamy, smily, authentic, analog, emphatic, confidence, caring. Enthusiastic, passionate. A bit fool. I am vegetarian, I make daily yoga and sport.  But i also love goings to bars and dancing. 

I couldnt live without music, drawing, books, cameras , sun, sea, friends, art , water & bananas. 

I love to travel for meeting myself in a different circumstances and making an exchange with the world and the people who one meet on the way. For learning. I am quite addicted to this exchange of new people and experiences.  I travel on my own city often, trying to watch it as if I was a tourist, as the first time again.  
I never had bad experiences traveling, and I believe is cause of the energy one projects . World is energy on movement and I enjoy going within it.
My best journey was walking alone "El camino de santiago"in Spain. India and Israel were also amazing-life-changing trips.  
I was "couchsourfer" for a long time when I was younger and I host over 100 people for free in Spain and Germany, that gave me a lot of life-teaching, a lot of respect , and unfortunately also a bit of suspicion.

host_about: Hello. I've been living in this exciting city for more than eight years and love Berlin. The city always thrives and there are so many options on how to spend you time. I'm a self employed PR consultant in the fields of tourism and political communication, with my office based in Kreuzberg, only 15 minutes away from my flat with a direct underground connection. My passion is my band and I play the lead guitar. I travel frequently to the US and Switzerland to visit my family, but try to tick off as many new places a year as possible.

space: From our corner one can already see the water of the canal where you can walk around, hang out in several nice bars, restaurants, cafés, galleries, etc.Right across the bridge is starting spot of a 3 hour canal boat tour, and a couple doors from ours is a great bike rental shop that rents Dutch(!) bikes. name: Beautiful, spacious room in central location
summary: Sehr großes und helles Zimmer mit Panorama Fenster im Dach und Kamin in zentraler Lage (viele Sehenswürdigkeiten fußläufig erreichbar).
space: Wir sind ein junges Paar und wohnen mit unserem kleinen Hund Finn in einer schönen, geräumigen Wohnung im 5. Stock eines Altbaus.  Die Wohnung liegt im 5.0G (mit Fahrstuhl) in einem schönen Altbau. Haus und Wohnung sind komplett saniert und in einem sehr guten Zustand. Das Bad wurde gerade neu gemacht und hat eine tolle Wellness-Dusche. Die Küche ist groß und geräumig und kann sehr gerne von unseren Gästen mitgenutzt werden (genauso wie die Waschmaschine). Unser Gästezimmer ist sehr groß (ca 25 m2) und gemütlich eingerichtet  Unser Zimmer liegt am anderen Ende der Wohnung durch einen Flur hinter der Küche getrennt und garantiert euch somit genug Privatsphäre.  We are a young couple in our 20´s living together with a small dog called Finn :) The flat is on the tth floor (with elevator) in a beautiful old building. The building and the room are renovated and in a very good condition. Our guest room is quite spacious (25ms), bright and cozy. The bathroom is new and contains a modern welln

neighborhood_overview: Die Wohnung ist sehr zentral gelegen. Fußläufig erreichbar sind Schloss Bellevue, Siegessäule, Reichstag, Brandenburger Tor etc. In der Nachbarschaft gibt es Einkaufsmöglichkeiten und Bäcker, sowie Restaurants und Cafés. Die Straße grenzt direkt an die Spree und den Tiergarten wo man wunderbar spazieren und eine Auszeit von der Großstadt nehmen kann. The flat is located very central. You can easily walk to sights such as the castle Bellevue, the Victory column, the Reichstag building, Brandenburg Gate etc. You'll find everything you´ll need just around the corner, such as grocery stores, bakeries and restaurants.
notes: Da die Wohnung sehr hochwertige Holzböden und Ausstattungen hat, ist es wichtig, dass damit umsichtig umgegangen wird. Das heißt, dass Zb keine Schuhe in der Wohnung getragen werden sollten. Because we have very high quality wooden floors please treat them carefully. That includes to please not wear shoes inside the flat.
transit: Die Verkehrsanbindung ist sehr gut. Man ist (für Berliner Verhältnisse) schnell sowohl im Osten, als auch im Westen der Stadt. 12 min zu Fuß vom Hauptbahnhof gelegen, sowie 20 min mit dem Bus vom Flughafen Tegel und 50 min vom Flughafen Schönefeld erreichbar. - Bus 245 direkt vor der Tür  -> schnelle Verbindung zum Hauptbahnhof, Friedrichstraße, Turmstraße und  Naturkundemuseum - Bus TXL - 5 Min zu Fuß -> schnelle Verbindung zum Flughafen Tegel ( 20 min) -S-Bahn Station Bellevue (S5 / S7 / S75) -ca 8 min zu Fuß  -> Mit der S-Bahn ist man beispielsweise in 2 Stationen am Zoologischen Garten oder in wenigen Stationen in die andere Richtung Hauptbahnhof, Hackescher Markt, Alexanderplatz oder Warschauer Straße. -U-Bhf Turmstraße ( U9) - ca 8 Min zu Fuß Very good connection for public transportation. You are fast in the western part of the city, same as the east. Quick connection to Hauptbahnhof ( 2 min by bus) and Airport Tegel (20 min by bus), (Airport Schönefeld, 50min by rain). - Bus 24
access: W-Lan / Wifi (Bitte hierzu die Regeln durchlesen/ Please read the rules for using the wifi) Küche mit Spülmaschine, Kaffeemaschine etc. / Kitchen with dish washer, coffee machine etc. Bad inklusive Waschmaschine / Bathroom including washing machine
interaction: Wir sind gebürtige Berliner mit jahrelanger Airbnb Erfahrung und helfen gerne jederzeit weiter und können euch definitiv einige Tipps geben. Wir freuen uns  immer neue Leute kennen zu lernen, achten aber ebenso jedermanns Freiraum und Privatsphäre.  We  are born and raised Berliner and love to help you out at any point. I am sure we can give you some helpful tipps. Don´t hesitate to ask  :) We always love to meet new people but on the same hand accept everyones privacy.
house_rules: - Die Nutzung unseres Internetzugangs während des Aufenthalts dient rein privaten Zwecken. Untersagt ist in jedem Fall der Aufruf von pornographischen, militärischen oder extremistischen Inhalten. Die Speicherung derartiger Inhalte auf PC's und Servern, sowie deren Weiterverbreitung ist ebenfalls strikt untersagt. Dazu gehören illegale Software, Musik und Filmmaterial. Mit eurer Buchung stimmt ihr dem zu.  My wifi is for private use only! You are not allowed to watch or download porn or illegal content. It's also strictly forbidden to Stream or download movies, series etc. You'll accept that by booking.
host_about: Open minded with a passion for traveling.

name: cozy Flat in Mitte
summary: Meine Unterkunft ist in der Nähe von der U- Bahn, S-bahn wie Straßenbahn. Der Rosenthalerplatz  ist in 5 Fußminuten gut zu erreichen, genauso wie der Mauerpark. Mit der U- Bahn ist man in 7 min am Alex. Da wir an der Grenze zum Wedding Hausen ist der Mauerstreifen 2min entfernt. Ebenfalls sind Supermärkte hier zahlreich vertreten. Meine Unterkunft ist gut für paare,Abenteurer und geschäftsreisende.  Lieben wirst du meine Wohnung wegen der Umgebung und der gemütlichen Einrichtung.

Einen großen Tisch wie ein Regel um seine Kleidung zu verstauen sind ebenfalls vorhanden. Bettwäsche& Handtücher werden natürlich auch von uns gestellt.

neighborhood_overview: Mitte/ Prenzlauer Berg ist ein sehr familienfreundlicher und gepflegter Stadtteil, einfach ein Kiez zum Wohlfühlen. Es gibt unzählige Bars, Clubs wie Restaurants, zahlreiche Cafés, attraktive Shops wie Galerien. Für jeden etwas zu haben. Für touristische Attraktionen zu Fuß ist hier natürlich auch vorgesorgt: der Mauerpark, die Gedenkstätte Berliner Mauer, das Brandenburger Tor, die Museumsinsel, der Hackescher Markt oder der Alexanderplatz sind gut zu Fuß erreichbar.
transit: Die Wohnung liegt sehr Zentral hat also die perfekte Anbindung. U-bahn (U8) ist nur ein paar Meter entfernt genauso wie die Tram (M10, M8, M1, 12) und der Bus. Die S- Bahn ist natürlich auch nicht weit und nur ein paar geh minuten von der Wohnung entfernt.

interaction: Meine Mitbewohnerin steht gerne zur Verfügung bei aufkommenden Fragen euch zu helfen.:)
house_rules: - Bitte verhalte dich so, wie du das von Gästen in deiner Wohnung auch erwarten würdest. Gehe achtsam mit den Dingen um. Ich bitte dich ebenfalls keine Partys zu veranstalten oder fremde Leute hier hin einzuladen. Fühle dich ansonsten wie zu Hause.

host_about:
Danielle is an artist and art teacher, Marcel writes for film, theater and the opera.
We spend our days and nights working or doing nothing or trying to live a meaningful live – at least in our definition of such.
Unfortunately, we sometimes tend to procrastinate which usually contradicts my philosophy of making the most of the moment … but maybe it doesn't. 
We share our apartment with a cute dog, lucy, who is loved by and loves everyone we know.

name: LOFT- 8 minutes from train station!
summary: Das Loft kann gerne für Foto-und Filmproduktionen gemietet werden, zurzeit ist es leider nicht möglich, es für Übernachtungen zu buchen. Bitte beachten Sie, dass es sich bei dem Tagespreis um einen Mindestpreis handelt und dass bei Film- und Fotoproduktionen ein individuelles Gastgeberangebot ausgehandelt wird.
space: This incredible loft of over (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) square feet captures the unique Berlin spirit and is located only 8 minutes by taxi from the main train station and only 14 minutes from the Airport Tegel.  It is located in a 110 year old factory, one of the very last ones in Berlin not bought by a developper and still full of artists. With its 4 Meter/13 feet ceilings and original concrete floors it has remained a rough industrial style character. The unique furniture consists of custom-made pieces or vintage collectibles. Even the Bakelite switches are original pieces from the 40s or 60s.  In the same factory complex you will find the famous Tangoloft (www.tangoloft-(email hidden) as well as a lounge run by one of the most prominent DJs in Berlin. There is a supermarket some 200m/800 feet away as well as a subway station (S-Bahn Wedding or S-Bahn Humboldhain) some (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) feet away.  Guests will find parking possibilities in front of the factory, free Wifi, flat TV, a

name: Cozy and nice room in an awesome neighborhood
summary: This is a room in a shared apartment. You live with creatives a musician and an actor in a typical berlin house (Altbau). As a nice add on we share a big living room. We are looking forward to welcome you!
description: This is a room in a shared apartment. You live with creatives a musician and an actor in a typical berlin house (Altbau). As a nice add on we share a big living room. We are looking forward to welcome you! You can use the living room. The apartment is close to one of the most hyped streets in Berlin. Round the corner you find supermarkets and cafes for having breakfast or just hang out. The Weserstraße one of the highly recommended streets to go to is just about ten minutes to walk. There are plenty of nice cafes, bars and little shops. A new tiny but super nice independent cinema just opened its doors in Wildenbruchstraße. So come over and check all the nice places out. The street you are located is quite chilled. Their a buses right around the corner going to the next u and s-Bahn stations. A bus from airport Schönefeld just stops at the flat.

neighborhood_overview: Den Namen verdankt die Straße dem Schloss Schönhausen im Pankower Ortsteil Niederschönhausen. Die Schönhauser Allee trägt seit dem 27. Dezember 1841 ihren Namen. Von ungefähr 1490 bis zum 17. Jahrhundert hieß die Straße Pankowscher Landweg, anschließend (bis ungefähr (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)rde sie Schönhauser Weg genannt. Vor ihrer endgültigen Umbenennung hieß die Straße rund 15 Jahre lang Chaussee vor dem Schönhauser Tor. Als weitere Namen sind noch Schönhausensche Landstraße, Chaussee nach Pankow, Chaussee nach Niederschönhausen, Pankower Chaussee überliefert. Straßenverlauf Die Allee beginnt an der Kreuzung Tor- Ecke Rosa-Luxemburg-Straße, dem früheren Schönhauser Tor der Berliner Zollmauer, an der Grenze zum Ortsteil Mitte als Verlängerung der Alten Schönhauser Straße. Auf rund drei Kilometern Länge verläuft sie in nördlicher Richtung durch den gesamten Ortsteil Prenzlauer Berg und überwindet dabei gut 14 Höhenmeter.[1] Ihren Mittelpunkt hat sie ungefähr an der Kreuzung zur Ecke Eber
transit: Individualverkehr Blick vom Park Inn Alexanderplatz Richtung Norden Wegweiser in der Wisbyer Straße östlich der Schönhauser Allee – Hinweis zur B 96a Der Abschnitt nördlich der Danziger Straße ist Teil der Bundesstraße 96a. Im Stadtentwicklungsplan Verkehr ist die Schönhauser Allee im Bestand auf ganzer Länge als Verkehrsachse des übergeordneten Straßennetzes, Stufe II (übergeordnete Straßenverbindung) ausgewiesen. Für die Planung 2015 ist wie für alle Straßen innerhalb des Innenstadtrings (d. h. südlich der Danziger Straße) eine Rückstufung vorgesehen, die südliche Schönhauser Allee ist hier nur noch als Straße der Stufe III (örtliche Straßenverbindung) aufgeführt.[4] Die durchschnittliche tägliche Verkehrsbelastung (DTV) der Schönhauser Allee lag im Jahr 2005 zwischen 18.800 (Schönhauser Tor bis Senefelderplatz) und 33.000 Fahrzeugen (Danziger Straße bis Wichertstraße) pro Werktag (WT).[5] Die parallelen Achsen Brunnenstraße, Prenzlauer Allee (Autobahnzubringer) und Greifswalder Stra

Although I am quite busy during the week with my medical studies, I am culturally very active. I have so many good advices to give on restaurants, bars, museums or places to visit.

summary: My place is situated in a very nice area of Berlin.  Full of restaurants, bars, cafes and not far from the city center. You’ll love my place because of the location, the neighborhood, and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: My apartment is a cozy 75 sqm duplex in the heart of Friedrichshain. It's on the ground and first floor. The ground floor is a big open space with a kitchen, a guest restroom, a dining room and a living room that opens on a big terrace. The two bedrooms and the main bathroom are on the first floor. You will be particularly pleased with the huge Italian shower. There is a bathtub as well.

notes: Wichtig bitte bei Buchung anfragen, ob wie oben beschrieben nur das Zimmer oder doch ganze Apartment vermietet wird. 1-2 der Anmerkungen in den wenigen kritischen Feedbacks, sind unter der Annahme entstanden, dass Gäste dachten, sie mieten das ganze Apartment für nur 35 bis 40 Euro und dann enttäuscht waren. Zum Preis allgemein. Ich denke 35 - 40 Euro ist auch für ein Zimmer mit Küchen- und Badnutzung angemessen, da die Lage mit ihrer Umgebung (Rosenthaler Platz, Mauerpark, Weinbergspark, Eberswalderstraße, Alexanderplatz, Hackescher Markt, Museumsinsel - das meiste in 5 bis 15 Minuten zu Fuß zu erreichen) einzigartig ist. Man erspart sich lange Anfahrtswege. Gerade zum Ausgehen erreicht man einige der besten Restaurants, Clubs, Cafe´s und Bar´s, die Berlin zu bieten hat zu Fuß und befindet sich trotzdem in einer sicheren Umgebung.

name: St. Meze Apartment
summary: 5 % Berlin City Tax will be charged on the arrival day in cash. Business travelers are excluded. We only need the confirmation of your company, that you travel on business.
space: Our 50 sqm guest apartment is calmly located on the ground floor of a backyard building. It has its own beautiful garden – an idyllic little gem in the middle of bustling city life. With select finds, concealed gimmicks and surprising details the apartment adopts the style of our adjoining St. Meze coffee shop. The apartment can be rented on a daily basis for 1 to 3 persons. It has a generous living and sleeping area with a full-size bed, a sofa bed, as well as a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom. Our apartment costs 70,00 EUR per night. The non-recurring final cleaning charge is 25,00 EUR. Cleaning costs won’t be charged with a duration of stay for at least 6 nights. The apartment is fully equipped with towels, bed linen etc. and has access to a little garden.

host_about:
As energy efficiency expert and PV/electric vehicle consultant we are living now in South East Asia.
We are running in the Philippines and Hongkong companies.
Between optimizing power plants and reducing the carbon emission of shopping mals we are enjoing the vibrant life style in Manila/HK/KL and Bangkok.

So our European home is only used for some weeks of the year.

Basically my wife and me do love to travel a lot. Building up relationships over the globe is amazing.

Clearly we do like sports (skiing, mountain biking, hiking) and nice food as well as nice wine ;-)

My wife is Russian and financial manager in a diesel trading company in Berlin and I am an electric Vehicles expert, working on a sustainable economic business case, which offers the balance between "making money" and "saving the planet".
So we do have some things to talk about….

Therefor as Austrian I am, living in Berlin and Dornbirn, doing a lot of global energy saving business, like optimizing steam boilers, heat generation and do create holistic energy reduction plans for enterprises.

We are also key members of the globes biggest shopping community, helping consumers to save money in all daily expenses.

house_rules: Liebe Gäste!   Sie verbringen Ihren Urlaub in einer privaten Ferienwohnung. Wir haben uns mit der Einrichtung Mühe gegeben und hoffen, dass Sie einen wunderschönen Urlaub hier in unserer Ferienwohnung verbringen.    Nachstehende Hausordnung soll eine Hilfestellung geben, in der wir nur beschreiben, wie wir uns den Umgang mit der Wohnung und dem Inventar im Idealfall vorstellen.   Außerdem haben wir, zu unserer Entlastung einige Regeln aufgeführt, von denen wir hoffen, dass sie Ihr Verständnis finden. Durch eine ordentliche Behandlung der Wohnung helfen Sie uns auch in Zukunft, Ihnen eine schöne Ferienwohnung zur Verfügung zu stellen. . Sollten Sie irgendetwas in der Einrichtung vermissen oder Sie brauchen Hilfe, wenden Sie sich vertrauensvoll an uns.       Sämtliche Dinge, die sich in der Ferienwohnung oder Balkon befinden oder dazugehören, dürfen und sollen von den Gästen benutzt werden. Bitte gehen Sie mit der gesamten Einrichtung und Inventar sorgsam um.   Der Mieter hat das Mietobj

name: Spacious room in Neukölln!
summary: Euch erwartet ein wunderschönes Zimmer (27qm) in unserer geräumigen, gut ausgestatteten Altbauwohnung im Herzen Neuköllns. Zahlreiche angesagte Bars und Restaurants findet ihr in Fußnähe. Das Zimmer, sehr ruhig zum Innenhof gelegen, ist der ideale Rückzugsort.
space: Die Wohnung liegt direkt an der Sonnenallee, einer der belebtesten Straßen mitten in dem angesagten Stadtteil Neukölln. Da das Zimmer zu dem sehr ruhigen, grünen Innenhof gelegen ist, kann man sich hier trotzdem sehr gut zurückziehen und sich von den Strapazen des aufregenden Großstadtlebens erholen. Die Wohnung liegt in einem sehr schönen, sanierten Altbau mit Dielenboden und hohen Decken. Sie liegt im 1. Stock, endloses Treppensteigen bleibt Euch also erspart.  Die Ausstattung des Zimmers erkennt Ihr am besten auf den Fotos! Es verfügt über ein 140cm-Bett, bei Bedarf können wir Euch eine zweite Matratze bereitlegen. Außerdem gibt es ein gemütliches Sofa mit Couchtisch, einen Sessel, einen sehr geräumigen Schreibtisch mit komfortablem Bürostuhl, Laserdrucker und Stereoanlage inkl. CD-Player, Plattenspieler und AUX-Anschluss.  In wenigen Gehminuten seid ihr auf der Weserstraße, einer der angesagtesten Ecken Neuköllns. Hier könnt Ihr eine ganze Fülle an Cafés, Bars, Restaurants, Klamott
description: Euch erwartet ein wunderschönes Zimmer (27qm) in unserer geräumigen, gut ausgestatteten Altbauwohnung im Herzen Neuköllns. Zahlreiche angesagte Bars und Restaurants findet ihr in Fußnähe. Das Zimmer, sehr ruhig zum Innenhof gelegen, ist der ideale Rückzugsort. Die Wohnung liegt direkt an der Sonnenallee, einer der belebtesten Straßen mitten in dem angesagten Stadtteil Neukölln. Da das Zimmer zu dem sehr ruhigen, grünen Innenhof gelegen ist, kann man sich hier trotzdem sehr gut zurückziehen und sich von den Strapazen des aufregenden Großstadtlebens erholen. Die Wohnung liegt in einem sehr schönen, sanierten Altbau mit Dielenboden und hohen Decken. Sie liegt im 1. Stock, endloses Treppensteigen bleibt Euch also erspart. transit: Bushaltestelle direkt vor der Haustür, von dort gelangt Ihr ohne Umsteigen z.B. zum Hauptbahnhof, Hermannplatz, Potsdamer Platz, Philharmonie etc. U-Bahnstationen der Linien U7 und U8, sowie die Ringbahn (Sonnenallee) sind in Fußnähe. Nach kurzem Suchen findet man in der Nachbarschaft immer schnell einen Parkplatz.
access: Neben Eurem Zimmer habt Ihr Zugang zum großzügigen Bad mit Badewanne und Dusche, sowie Waschmaschine, die Ihr bei Bedarf natürlich gern auch benutzen dürft. Außerdem steht Euch unsere Küche zur Verfügung. Hier findet Ihr alles, was man zum Kochen so braucht (Elektroherd mit Ofen, Spülmaschine, Mikrowelle, Toaster, Wasserkocher, Standmixer, Sandwichmaker etc.) Außerdem kann man hier mit Blick auf die Sonnenallee sehr gemütlich sitzen.
interaction: Ich stelle mein Zimmer zur Verfügung und werde während Eures Aufenthalts verreist sein. Meine beiden Mitbewohner sind da und stehen Euch für Fragen und Tipps jederzeit gern zur Verfügung!
house_rules: Da ihr die Wohnung mit meinen beiden Mitbewohnern teilt, bitte ich Euch, insbesondere abends bezüglich der Lautstärke etwas Rücksicht zu nehmen.
host_about: Hello there.

host_about:
Hi, my name is Daniel. Hallo Ich bin der Daniel :)

-since this is a rather international community I'll write in English, but I speak fluent German, English and Hungarian. 

I am an Actor/Singer/Dancer living in Berlin. I am happy to share my own place through the cumminuty, together with my friend Dalma. We are looking forward to welcome you and provide you with a great and comfortable stay in West-Berlin, in one of the nicest residential areas of the city in the 'Bayerischen-Viertel' (Bayern-Distric). This area is rich in parks and in pre-war architecture, and shows a more traditional look of the Berlin as it was before the second world war. Yet it is all very close to the modern city life of Kurfürstendamm, Zoo, Tiergarten, Nollendorfplatz, Potsdamer Platz and to all the vibrant metropolis features that the city has become to offer.  
______________________________________________________
About me:
 I don't have pets and I do not smoke. I prefer quiet evenings with a good movie, self made healthy food, listening to the the daily news, and some educative documentaries with a glass of good wine. I usually travel with my own car, and I travel a lot between  the Budapest and Düsseldorf, Hamburg and Vienna axis. I prefer hand-luggage over hiking-gear and positively thinking people with ideas of the world to talk about as company. Looking forward to meet you in person.

name: Bright & Spacious Rooftop Loft Style Apartment
summary: Newly renovated modern spacious rooftop 2-bedroom apartment with a retro touch located in a vibrant neighborhood close to everything. The place is 120 sqm & each bedroom has queen-size beds; one room with a French balcony & the other with a regular balcony. The living room has a large comfy sofa, a dining area connected to another balcony. There are two bathrooms, one with a nice big bathtub with large windows above. The place also has a washing machine, dish washer & well supplied kitchen.
space: Located between Frankfurter Allee and Ostkreuz Berlin. We are renting out the entire 120 sqm flat, including 2 bedrooms for 2 people each + more space to sleep on our comfy couch as well. The apartment is very bright and offers a spacious and well supplied kitchen next to the 1st balcony, a big luxurious bathroom including bath tub and additional guest toilet. The modern loft style livingroom includes a dinner table for 6 people, a very comfortable couch, rocking chair and danish retro couch table. From the first bedroom you have access to the gangway towards the fire stairs on the backside of the house which we use as our second balcony, to catch some evening sun when possible.

notes: We have an additional sleaping area added on top of the two private bedrooms.
transit: A great benefit of the location is the great connection to public transportation, which allows you to reach pretty much every part of Berlin in no time. Having the Ring Train, S-Bahn, regular Underground and Tram 4-5 min away from the house gets you to be in Kreuzberg, Neukölln, Mitte/Alexanderplatz and Prenzlauer Berg in about 15 minutes only. Even Kurfürstendamm and Berlin Zoologischer Garten are not further away than 30 minutes by train.

space: Its in a yery nice furnished 2 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor of an historical building on a nice leafy street. One block away from the idyllic Landwehrkanal (with swans!) and one block from Görlitzer park. Many nice bars and restaurants in the immediate area. Görlitzer Bahnhof U-bahn station is 2 blocks away for easy access to other neighborhoods, although there are many amenities in the immediate area. The outdoor Turkish market on Maybachufer, with its multitude varieties of produce, cheeses, olives, textiles, housewares, etc., happens every Tuesday and Friday and is about 2.5 blocks away. This is where I do most of my grocery shopping, as the prices are good and everything is very fresh. The apartment is situated directly above an Italian deli / coffee shop which is outstanding. neighborhood_overview: My apartment is located next to famous Schloss (Castle) Charlottenburg which is main attraction of the district.  You have also good connection with Berlin Zoologischer Garten, Berlin Fair (Messe Berlin) and ICC – International Congress Centre. Just opposite the building there is very nice playground for children. There are 3 supermarkets within 100 meters - ALDI, Kaisers and Penny. notes: Due to new legal regulations in Berlin we accept only reservations for min. 60 days and longer.
transit: The nearest public transportation is: S-Bahn (city rail) – station WESTEND – 200 meters. U-Bahn (subway) – station Richard Wagner Platz (U7 line) and Sophie Charlotte Platz (line U2) – 800 meters Bus – line M45 to Zoologischer Garten – just downstairs! During your stay you can use our safe, private parking place (5 EUR/day). The apartment is just 200 meters away from exit form internal highway A100 (Stadtring) – exit number 6 Spandauer Damm. Connection from Tegel Airport – bus 109 to stop Luisenplatz (15 min). Connection from Schonefeld Airport – city train (S-Bahn) to station Westend (50 min). Connection from railway station Berlin HBF - S-Bahn to station Westend (20 min). Connection from bus station Berlin ZOB - S-Bahn to station Westend (10 min) or 15 min. walk.

Check-in directly at the apartment - on the day of check-in please just call/text us 30 minutes before check-in to confirm your arrival or in case of any delay. If you will be late more than 1 hour and you do not inform us about it we can add 10 EUR for each hour of waiting for you.  You can use our private parking place - 10 EUR per night. CityTax 5%.

host_about:
I'm a very free spirit with an organized life. Sometimes it's a blissful combination, sometimes it's more like a box of angry cats. I run my own business organizing yoga classes in schools and businesses, so I am very much able to structure my time as I wish, which makes me very happy. I like to take LONG trips, especially when I'm going far away (next stop: bali!) to really soak in the new place I'm going to. I also love the enforced quiet and reflection that comes with traveling alone, the test of any friendship or relationship that comes with traveling together.

I've been an airbnb host for a while now, and I've met some pretty amazing people. I think my apartment absorbs some of the energy of everyone who visits, and I love to host interesting people.

name: Friedrichshain/The WALL/6Min Center
summary: The apartment is located in a nice, quiet, family-oriented part of east Berlin. Many people choose to go straight into the city from here, which isn't far. However, on the other side of the neighborhood there is the Rummelsburger Bay, for nice walks.
space: My name is Bianca I am originally from the States, but have now made my home here in Berlin. The apartment for rent is my personal apartment, cleared of my belongings, of course. The location of the apartment is on the border between Friedrichshain and Lichtenberg in Berlin. Friedrichshain over the past few years has become "the" hotspot for night life, shopping and the cultural/art scene here in Berlin. Friedrichshain offers something for everyone: shopping, tourist attractions, great connections to anywhere in the city, nightlife, restaurants, art and creativity and among the locals is considered one of the best neighborhoods. The Berlin Wall - East Side Gallery- is only 2 stations by Sbahn (approx. 5 min) from the apartment. Near the wall are many other galleries, underground shops, and other shopping areas. Also, in that same vicinity you can see the famous Oberbaum Brücke, the Spree river, Görlitzer Park, Treptower Park with the Soviet Memorial and many other attractions.  The apa

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and safe, with lots of families and younger people. There are lots of small cafés, shops and parks around. The Bay is just across the way (about 10 minute walk) and access to the city is fast and easy (10 minutes from the apt door to city center with the Sbahn). I just ask that you let down the blinds in the apartment before you leave it, just to be safe.  Besides me, the building has 3 families with children, and two young couples living in it. It's a quiet building except when everyone in the house gets together in the courtyard for a summer grill.
transit: Sbahn (Nöldnerplatz S5, S7, S75) is located 2-5 minutes walking from the apartment. The Sbahn (Rummelsburg S3) is also only 2-5 minutes walk. Should you want to get to Ostkreuz directly from the apartment you can also walk there - it's approx. a 10 minute walk.
access: Internet; full kitchen; tea & coffee
interaction: I am easily reached through (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN).
house_rules: Please no parties! And please lock the door and let down all the blinds in the apartment before taking off for the day.
host_about:
I am currently a PhD candidate for forensic & legal psychology and need to travel a lot for my studies/work. I am originally from the States (with a bilingual background - German & English). 6 years ago I moved to Berlin to begin a Masters program and instantly fell in love with the city. 

I enjoy meeting new people and sharing what I know about the city, which is what I will do for you if you stay with me, and my schedule allows it. If I am not here, there is a wide array of Berlin and German tour guides, both underground and main stream that are available in the apartment.  

Because I travel a lot of the time, most likely my neighbor and friend Susanna will take care of letting you into the apartment and the key exchange. You will be renting the entire apartment (2 bedrooms, 1 living room, kitchen and full bath). If I am in Berlin during your stay, I will most likely be upstairs in another apartment and will be around for any questions you may have. 

If you have any questions or would like more information please feel free to message me anytime, and I will respond ASAP. :)

host_about:
I think I could say I am free, open, easy, tolerant, dreamy, smily, authentic, analog, emphatic, confidence, caring. Enthusiastic, passionate. A bit fool. I am vegetarian, I make daily yoga and sport.  But i also love goings to bars and dancing. 

I couldnt live without music, drawing, books, cameras , sun, sea, friends, art , water & bananas. 

I love to travel for meeting myself in a different circumstances and making an exchange with the world and the people who one meet on the way. For learning. I am quite addicted to this exchange of new people and experiences.  I travel on my own city often, trying to watch it as if I was a tourist, as the first time again.  
I never had bad experiences traveling, and I believe is cause of the energy one projects . World is energy on movement and I enjoy going within it.
My best journey was walking alone "El camino de santiago"in Spain. India and Israel were also amazing-life-changing trips.  
I was "couchsourfer" for a long time when I was younger and I host over 100 people for free in Spain and Germany, that gave me a lot of life-teaching, a lot of respect , and unfortunately also a bit of suspicion.

Very sunny room, equipped with curtains. Please inform us if you need two beds or one before your arrival.
interaction: If the guests and ourselves have time, it is always a pleasure to spend some time with them and get to know them, go out with them or just hang out at home. We both work full time though and have a busy schedule so it all depends. Of course we don't mind at all if the guests don't feel like interacting. We are totally fine with that too!
house_rules: _ Please NO DOWNLOADING! In Germany it is illegal to download films, series, music etc and you could end up in court & will have to pay a big fine for that. Turn off your torrents or any other download sites, BEFORE you log in in our wifi. You can find the wifi password on a paper. Please fill in with your personal data. _You are not allowed to have guests, unless we are aware and ok with it. _This is a no shoes apartment. Please take your slippers with you, ask us to lend a pair or walk with no shoes inside. We have expensive rugs, that we cannot afford to have cleaned every time a guest leaves. My parents had a no shoes policy in their house and I always despised them for that and felt bad when they asked my friends to take off their shoes. But guess what? I now do the same. :) On top I have a dust allergy and need a dustless environment. _You need to lock the door if you leave the flat if noone is at home and shut down the windows. You shouldn't use the latch (lock on the door), bec
host_about:
My name is Dina and I was born and raised in Greece, but have been living since 10 years in Berlin. 

I have studied law, but at the moment work at an electronic music promotion and booking agency and as a dj. I speak English, German, Italian, Spanish and Greek.

I live in Friedrichshain, Berlin with my husband Max, who is working as a product manager at two music labels. We are in our thirties and work every day during the week and travel or dj and party on the weekend. We dj and produce electronic music (slow techno, acid, post disco, chug), have a blog and run our own events. 

We love traveling, music, films, art, parties and meeting new interesting people. 

We enjoy having friends over at ours and are smokers.

★★★★★ ★★★★★

You are welcome to Berlin! We would love to help you have a great time here, give you tips (sightseeing or partying) and if there is time and will from both sides, hang out with you!

Find the room with the title:
Cute sunny room in Friedrichshain

Rarely we can offer you the room with the title:
Sunny Room with a great view in FH!

We are always happy to meet new people from all over the world! 

But after doing airbnb for four years now and having made different experiences, we are a bit picky.

Requirements:
We prefer to host adults between 22-45 years old, you need to have a picture and write in your request what you do for a living and what is the purpose of your travel. We will be staying a few nights under the same roof, so it would be good if we more or less got along.

 We would also prefer to have guests who will not be cooking at home (had the forgotten hot plate/stove or burnt pans and smell all over the house way too many times so far. It's not really worth the risk, since our own flat/things are at stake, so we prefer to be careful than sorry). You can of course keep things in the fridge, just no cooking please. Eating out in Berlin is very cheap anyways and we are happy to give you tips.

We also have the rule of no shoes in the house, you would have to leave them in the flat by the entrance. 

You are not allowed to bring people back to the flat. No extra guests please!

Please contact us and don't hesitate to ask us any questions.

name: Charming-large room in top location, full of light
summary: A gorgeous room with a high ceiling, full of light, space and quiet in a charming Altbau Berlin apartment. Access to the kitchen, living room, bathrooms, internet, towels, bedsheets etc, and of course you would be in famous Prenzlauerberg the nicest and most trendy areas of Berlin!  I am happy to welcome solo travelers as well as couples or friends from all background.
space: The room is 30m2 with a high ceiling, full of light, space and quiet.  There is a working station as well as an electric piano for the more artistic souls, a library and a wardrobe as your disposal. The bed is a 140x200 double bed! You would have access to everything the apartment has to offer (kitchen, living room, bathrooms, internet, towels, bedsheets etc). I absolutely love this apartment not only for its perfect location but for the light and the quiet that it offers.  It has been decorated with love, care and a certain "french touch" since I am originally from Paris. The one thing to know is that the apartment is organized a little strangely and although there is a restroom and a sink reserved for the guests in the entrance, you have to cross my bedroom to access the bathroom. It has never been a problem with any guests and during the day until late at night this bedroom serves as a passage room since I spend very little time in there anyways.

neighborhood_overview: Prenzlauerberg is one of, if not THE nicest and most trendy areas of Berlin! You'll find plenty of cafes, delicious restaurants, cute shops and the famous Mauerpark as well as a farmer's market twice a week down the road from me.
transit: The closest Ubahn is Eberswalderstrasse (U2), 5min away, or Senefeldplatz 10 min walk from the apartment. The U2 line is most convenient as it crosses the entire city. Several trams, all within 5min walk, will quickly take you to Alexanderplatz in 10 min, Mitte, Berlin Haupbanhof, and Friedrichstrasse.
interaction: I am tidy and quiet, but I enjoy sharing a meal and a good conversation. In other words I am happy to interact and give you Berlin recommendations if you wish but I respect privacy and the apartment is definitely big enough for 2 or 3 people to coexist happily! I am not necessarily sleeping in this apartment every night since I am often at my partner's house but if I happened not to be here I am available in my phone 24/7 and only a few stops away if needed.

neighborhood_overview: Although I live very cetral  - it is very quiet in the evening and at the weekends, because this is an untypical residential area (more a business district). But the next street with a lot of bars, clubs, restaurants, open-late stores and shops is very close (10min by bus). Moreover there are 2 big shoppingsmalls accessible on foot (15min): Mall of Berlin @Leipziger Platz and Potsdamer Arcaden @Potsdamer Platz.  Alexanderplatz is also close: 15min by public transportation. If you are interested in german politics the government district is close as well as Checkpoint Charly with the whole history about the german wall that  once separates Germany for over 28 years. The Brandenburg Gate is close, too.  A "Lidl" supermarket is accessible in 3-5min on foot, furthermore are here several baker, 2 flower shops, a pharmacy (Mo-Fr) and several cafés und restaurants, Starbucks, McDonalds, KFC in the immediate vicinity.  If you have children with you here is a playground close, too.
notes: I have a cat - his name is Jonny :)
transit: Underground Station: U6: Checkpoint Charlie/Kochstraße U2: Stadtmitte U2: Spittelmarkt Bus: M49: Charlottenstraße 248 & M29: Lindenstr./Oranienstr 265 & M48: Jerusalemer Str.
access: You will have access to all my rooms - as long as you live here I will sleep in my livingroom and you'll get my comfortable bedroom with own access to the balcony. Of course you can use bathroom and kitchen. The latter is only available when I am not sleeping because you need to go through the livingroom to the kitchen. If you have bikes with you it is possible to place them safely in the inner courtyard. If you travel by car you can park it in the street in front of the house, the parking is free and you have good chances to get a parking space in the evening (from 4:30 pm, before it is very busy here).

name: Large and bright apartment in PBerg
space: Situated close to Eberswalderstraße and around the corner from Mauerpark with its flea market and arts performances as well as Kastanienallee with its dozens of cafes for Sunday brunch is my large 85 sq meter apartment. The apartment has a wooden floor, high ceilings with stucco decoration and is kept in warm crème-color and brown tones. It is situated at the southern side of the building in the third floor which guarantees lots of sun all day long. Your room is 25 sq. meters (225 sq. feet) large with space in the closet and wardrobe for your clothes and belongings. The bed is 2,0 x 1,4 meters and provides enough space for two. For your stay you can use the nice and modern kitchen that features an oven, a dish washer, a washing machine and a dryer for your cloth.  The wireless internet allows you to research latest events in Berlin or share your experiences with friends and family at home. With the fixed phone you can make reservations at the places you want to visit or confirm opening

name: High above the roofs of Berlin
summary: Enjoy Berlin off the beaten path in hot and coming Moabit (Mitte) and join us in a 160m2 appartment high above the roofs of Berlin. 10 minutes by bus from Tegel Airport or the Hauptbahnhof. Close to Tiergarten. Discover new bars and a foody paradise.
space: Welcome to our bohemian paradise with a view! A very spacious 160m2 with wooden floors offer enough room to breathe and relax. We rent out a very quiet room at the "end of the west wing" of our apartment which provides you all the privacy you need. If you wish, you can enter your room through a separate entrance from your own staircase. The room offers a queensize bed and your own workdesk. We provide high speed Internet, your own TV (with cable), you can scan and print in our homeoffice or just relax on the big patio or the living room with a view on the TV Tower.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the Berlin district of Mitte - in Moabit - Berlin's inner city island (no kidding!). Moabit offers a wild mix of renovated old-style buildings, old-style Berlin charms and the pounding heartbeat of a fast-changing formerly rougher neighborhood with hidden bar and cafe gems. It is a 10 Minute walk to the Spree's riverside, a 10 Minute bikeride to one of Berlins most beautiful inner city swimming lakes and 10 Minute bikeride to the famous Tiergarten or Berlin hottest galleries.
notes: We live in the 5th floor. There is no elevator!
transit: The area around Turmstraße is well connected to various buslines and the U9. City East and City West are short busrides. Wherever you wanna go, it is a short ride. More info on  (URL HIDDEN) Moabit is well connected to Prenzlauer Berg via Ringbahn, too.
access: You can use the full apartment - Fully equipped open kitchen (dishwasher, espressomashine), huge livingroom with sound system (apple airplay connected) and projector,  bathroom (tub, rainshower, washingmashine, dryer). Wifi. Feel at home away from home.  You can even use the bar (just fill up whatever you empty...)
interaction: How much we interact with you depends on your schedule and ours. Both of us are usually pretty busy, but if time allows we are happy to give you some backgroundinfo over a glass of red or white on where to get the best food in town or which bar is a must, but we will not torture you with an unsollicited holiday picture show ;-)
house_rules: Really nothing special. We wish that you treat us, the apartment and our neighbors as you want to be treated.
host_about:
Who am I? 

I am a passionate filmmaker / traveler / writer / Ashtanga Yogi. Love to cook, for friends and myself. Care for good wine, interesting conversations and books of almost any kind from graphic novels to the classics of literature.

Also, there is a supermarket in the same street that one can reach by foot in just 2 minutes!. Meine Unterkunft ist gut für paare, alleinreisende abenteurer und geschäftsreisende.

name: 60m2 mit grandiosem Blick über Berlin
summary: Meine Unterkunft ist direkt an der East Side Gallery. Perfekt gelegen zwischen Friedrichshain und Kreuzberg ist sie der optimale Sightseeingausgangspunkt.  Die Wohnung selbst hat alle Annehmlichkeiten wie Fußbodenheizung oder Deckenkühlung. Die Einrichtung besteht aus hochwertigen Markenmöbeln und Geräten. Für Nichtkenner von Berlin kann euch der Concierge im Haus  bei allen Fragen behilflich sein.
space: Die Wohnung ist in einem der bekanntesten Häuser Berlins - dem Living Levels - direkt an der East Side Gallery gelegen. Die Wohnung hat einen unverbaubaren Blick über Berlin - vor allem am Abend ein absolutes Highlight! Die Wohnung ist im Industrial Stil eingerichtet. Rohe Betonböden und -decken, dunkel gestrichene Wände und tolle Designermöbel (z.B. von Vitra) machen die Wohnung zu einem absoluten Style-Highlight.  Ihr habt ebenfalls eine voll ausgestattete Küche mit Miele Geräten - auch ein Geschirrspüler - und einer Nespresso Machine. Ebenfalls sind in der Wohnung eine Waschmaschine sowie ein Trockner von Miele vorhanden. Was braucht man mehr?

neighborhood_overview: Friedrichshain und Kreuzberg sind zur Zeit die angesagtesten Viertel in Berlin. Die Kunst und Partyszene ist hier ebenso vertreten wie zahlreiche kleine Boutiquen und Geschäfte, die zum Bummeln einladen.
transit: Ihr könnt direkt vor dem Haus parken. Ansonsten sind die Haltestellen Ostbahnhof oder Warschauer Brücke nur 5min entfernt.

house_rules: If you’re coming to Berlin to have fun you’ve picked a great city to do so. Unfortunately, just not at our place. Though we’re sure it won’t come to it, serious complaints of unruly behavior will unfortunately result in you being asked to leave. Not good for you. Not good for us. Check-in is at 14:00, and check-out is by 10:00. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. Being a private apartment, we have a no smoking policy. What you do in your personal time is entirely up to you, but when staying at our place we have a strict no drug use policy.  To keep our costs down (and pass those savings on to our guests) we kindly ask that you switch off lights and heating when its not in use or leaving the house. Mother nature thanks you too. host_about:
hey there. 
I'm studying dance theory and i'm finishing a yoga teacher training this summer. Besides that i like to hang out with my friends, go to the gym, see a performance, cook, read or travel. I moved to Berlin in 2009 and it doesn't look like i'm going to move away in the close future ;-) .
Since this year i'm living in Schöneberg on the red island, one of my favourite areas in town.
When i travel, i really like to stay in a nice apartment/house,so that i can withdraw myself a bit to enjoy my holiday.
I think my apartment exactly gives you the chance to relax, especially after a nice breakfast on the balcony with a wide Berlin Panorama View (you see Potsdamer Platz, Alexander Platz and Kreuzberg).

I hope i'll get to know you as a guest, or host in the future.

So far, all the best
Stephan

house_rules: No smoking please. Check-in after 20:00 and on Sunday / holiday costs 20 EUR.  Please inform us about your estimated check-in time 7 days before arrival. host_about:
I think I could say I am free, open, easy, tolerant, dreamy, smily, authentic, analog, emphatic, confidence, caring. Enthusiastic, passionate. A bit fool. I am vegetarian, I make daily yoga and sport.  But i also love goings to bars and dancing. 

I couldnt live without music, drawing, books, cameras , sun, sea, friends, art , water & bananas. 

I love to travel for meeting myself in a different circumstances and making an exchange with the world and the people who one meet on the way. For learning. I am quite addicted to this exchange of new people and experiences.  I travel on my own city often, trying to watch it as if I was a tourist, as the first time again.  
I never had bad experiences traveling, and I believe is cause of the energy one projects . World is energy on movement and I enjoy going within it.
My best journey was walking alone "El camino de santiago"in Spain. India and Israel were also amazing-life-changing trips.  
I was "couchsourfer" for a long time when I was younger and I host over 100 people for free in Spain and Germany, that gave me a lot of life-teaching, a lot of respect , and unfortunately also a bit of suspicion.

name: Bright room in 1870s-building, german lessons opt.
summary: An old Berlin-style building ( 1870s) with a spacious and bright room to yourself, renovated bathroom and a calm neighborhood with a nice coffee bar, few restaurants, a tiny organic supermarket and a frequent public transport five stops to Alexanderplatz. As a german teacher I offer one-to-one classes in german and trips to my favorite places in Berlin. If you are interested, let's (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) or write about it.
space: I love design, colours and unique objects and I love to travel myself. That is why I  share my guestroom, which is bright, 26 squaremeters and typical for an old and original Berlin building from 1870s. The furniture is displayed on the photos, but the bed is a double-bed now, suitable for two people.  The bathroom is modern and renovated, the kitchen small and functional.
description: An old Berlin-style building ( 1870s) with a spacious and bright room to yourself, renovated bathroom and a calm neighborhood with a nice coffee bar, few restaurants, a tiny organic supermarket and a frequent public transport five stops to Alexanderplatz. As a german teacher I offer one-to-one classes in german and trips to my favorite places in Berlin. If you are interested, let's (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) or write about it. The furniture is displayed on the photos, but the bed is a double-bed now, suitable for two people.  The bathroom is modern and renovated, the kitchen small and functional. Enjoy my furniture as if it was yours:. I use the room (which of course has its own door and privacy) as a guestroom for friends or as living room while its not rented. Therefore you find my b
neighborhood_overview: Victoria-Kiez, where I live is a pre-cool area of Berlin, where gentrification has  just started. I like the mixture of little-village-feeling and metropolitan life.  Down my street is a very good bagel and espresso bar, few restaurants, the best icecream in town :-) and a supermarket, which is open until 10 p.m. even on saturdays - which is not so common in germany. There a two stores selling organic food (and vegan groceries) within 5-10 minutes walk. For the visual hunger there are two art galleries down the streets and in the neighbours building. If you like nightlife you are within 10 bicycle minutes of "about blank", "Wilde Renate" and "sysiphos", three places to be if you are into Berlin electronic music scene. Berghain is 20 bicycle minutes away.
notes: You will be sharing the apartment with me and two cats (Mrs. Konrad and Kasimir).
transit: Very frequent and straight connection to "the centre": 10 minutes travel to Alexanderplatz and 20 minutes to Brandenburger Tor or Friedrichsstraße by S-Bahn. The S-Bahn-Stop Nöldnerplatz connects you directly and frequently with the whole city until 1 a.m at night. Weekends all night long.  Trains run every 5 minutes and during weekends all night long (during night about every 15-30 Minutes).  There is no parking fee in my neighbourhood (yet) and depending on your arrival time it is easy to find a parking lot. In the evenings it is harder than during day.  If you arrive by plane, it takes 45 minutes to my place (both Tegel and Schönefeld), by  train 20 minutes from the Central Station Hauptbahnhof.
access: Enjoy my furniture as if it was yours:. I use the room (which of course has its own door and privacy) as a guestroom for friends or as living room while its not rented. Therefore you find my books on the shelf and my favourite furniture there.  There is a functional bike waiting for you and a rental-shop down the street, if you come as a couple, and need another one. We share the modern bathroom, towels will be provided as well as shampoo or showergel in case you need some.  The kitchen and fridge are at your disposal, too.  You can use spices and basic kitchen stuff like oil or butter. On your first day you can make yourself espresso or porridge before you go on your first grocery shopping tour.  During summer it is nice to sit in the backyard of the house or relax in the hammock in the garden.
interaction: Sometimes we exchange recipes, music, interesting thoughts, sometimes we just respect each others privacy or have one tea together on arrival, if we feel like it. If you have questions or problems, I will always be available by mobile.
house_rules: I would like you to enjoy and respect the room and the flat as if it was yours. It is not a hotel, it is a home- for me and for you during your stay.  It is a nice gesture if you take off your shoes in the apartment, but it is no obligation.  So far 80 guests have stayed at my place and brought a lot of interesting thoughts, impressions, recipes and shared experiences into my life! I am looking forward to every new guest.   I love nature and I try not to spoil water and energy but that does not mean that I never do long showers or a bath once in a while.  If you like to smoke you can use an open window in the hallway or take a seat in the garden.
host_about: In this digital world, I love the beauty of "live" encounters. Real World:  A new location, a live tune somewhere on the street or pioneers and travelers from all over the world, who tell interesting stories.

neighborhood_overview: The district of Wedding has been touted as the latest hipster hub for so long now that it's hard to know if it's continues to evolve into one of the capital's buzzier locations or not. ;) Turn-of-the-20th-century courtyards provide an unexpected link to the area's industrial past, with painted signs for long-vanished businesses still clinging to crumbling walls. At this hidden Berlin you'll find a couple of Wedding's hipper hangouts. Like the “ Kleine Bar“, “Anita Berber“ Club,  “kauf dich glücklich Outlet“ etc.  And you are really fast in other nice areas, like the big points to see near Friedrichsstraße - Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, Unter den Linden etc. - as well you are with two stops in the middle of Prenzlauer Berg at Schönhauser Allee with nice little shops, cafés etc. And you can take a walk to the Berlin Wall Memorial.
notes: We have no lift and only a pubilc wifi hotspot... but good coffee and magazins :) discover the city!
transit: U6, S-Bahn S41/42, Bus 247 Station S+U Wedding (Ring)or  S Humboldthain (north-south Connection) You can get via bus from the airport to the stop Beusselstraße and be quick here via S-Bahn (Ring).

name: Huge Flat in the Heart of Berlin
summary: My lovely apartment is located in Prenzlauer Berg, right next to the famous Kollwitz Platz. It has easy access to public transportation and is furnished with a mix of beautiful antiques/modern stuff. It provides all amenities - just check in and relax. Pleace read the whole description of my flatSome of the pictures are outdated, the furniture in the childrens room has changed.  The flat is not suitable for cat allergics - superfriendly catliving here.
space: Unsere 120 qm große Wohnung liegt mitten im Prenzlauer Berg, nur 5 Minuten entfernt vom berühmten Kollwitzplatz handelt sich um einen wunderschönen sanierten Altbau von 1890 mit Holzfußböden und Stuck und 3,80 m hohen Decken in der ersten Etage. Das große Schlafzimmer verfügt über ein Doppelbett (180x200), Deckenventilator, Verdunklungsrollos, Kleiderschränke, Kommoden und einen Schreibtisch. host_about:
Ich bin Juristin und lebe mit meiner Tochter (7Jahre alt) in Prenzlauer Berg. 

In meiner Freizeit reise ich gerne nach Asien für längere Aufenthalte oder in den nahen Osten, Afrika und Europa für Städtetrips. Ich liebe Individualreisen und war nur ein einziges schreckliches Mal pauschal unterwegs. Ich liebe die indische und laotische Küche - esse aber auch gerne die hausgemachte Pasta bei unserem Lieblingsitaliener direkt vorm Haus, den Du unbedingt besuchen solltest, wenn Du bei uns wohnen wirst.

Enjoy Berlin!

name: Sunny Room with a great view!
summary: We offer a clean, simple room with a proper 1,5m bed (for 1 or 2 people) in our flat. It is situated in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. Mostly German and international people in their 25-40 live around. It is not in the touristic area, but it is extremely close to everything. Very well communicated day and night with trams and sbahn. Just one sbahn ( s9 in 35mins) to get to Schönefeld, just 11 mins to Alexander Platz and 2 tram stops to be in the heart of Fhain. Very close to most clubs too.
space: Our flat consists of a living room, a big room, a smaller bedroom, a bathroom with a bath tub and a kitchen with a washing machine and a dishwasher. It is situated in Friedrichshain, one of the coolest areas in Berlin. Very central, sunny and good communicated with Sbahn, tram and bus. Amazing view over Friedrichshain, top floor and very quite. Alt bau, recently renovated, super new. We are renting the smaller room for a maximum period of two weeks.  When we are away we rent also the bigger room. The area is quite but still very close to Simon Dach Strasse, one of the busiest streets in Berlin with loads of cafes, restaurants, shops etc. Just a few meters from our flat you can find bakeries, late night shops, bars, pizzerias, restaurants. You can move very easily, as it is very good connected with Sbahn and tram right round the corner. The tram runs 24/7, so there is always a way to get to our flat easily.
